meanings.definition: Awkward or clumsy in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: The gawkiest puppy tripped over its own paws.
meanings.sent2: She felt self-conscious in the gawkiest outfit she owned.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dance gracefully, he ended up looking the gawkiest of them all.
meanings.sent4: Among the swans, the duckling felt like the gawkiest creature in the pond.
meanings.sent5: His attempts at painting were the gawkiest display of artistry.

meanings.sent1: The gawkiest giraffe struggled to reach the leaves on the tall tree.
meanings.sent2: Her movements on the ice were the gawkiest of all the skaters.
meanings.sent3: In her oversized shoes, she felt like the gawkiest clown at the circus.
meanings.sent4: The old car moved down the road in the gawkiest manner, sputtering and shaking.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's first steps were the gawkiest yet most endearing sight.

meanings.sent1: He was the gawkiest of all the students when it came to ballroom dancing.
meanings.sent2: The gawkiest dancer at the party kept stepping on toes.
meanings.sent3: The gawkiest waiter in the restaurant managed to spill drinks on every table.
meanings.sent4: The gawkiest player on the team always seemed to fumble the ball.
meanings.sent5: The gawkiest moment of the play was when the lead actor forgot his lines.
